pros: Fits true to size; Balanced cushioning; Lightweight for stability shoes; Good lockdown; Stable platform; Fun to run in; Very comfortable; Improved lacing
cons: Grip is not reliable; Durability problems
RR_verdict: I recognized the significant similarity between this Hoka’s lightweight stability shoe and its predecessor, the Arahi 5, with a nice, even amount of cushioning and consistent yet subtle stability. This shoe took me through long miles and helped me with recovery runs. What’s more, it’s lightweight, especially compared to its chunky aesthetic.
awards: Top pick in best running shoes for plantar fasciitis, Top 18% most popular running shoes
